instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
3V42 - stable
<TRANSISTOR>Q6920</TRANSISTOR> pin3 and 6 -1V and goes down
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - 3.25V
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> - 17V

threads.title: [SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Post voltages for <CHIP>U6915</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR>/15.
Most usual <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U6915</CHIP> get burnt...

threads.title: [SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
[SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do you get 7V aprox on pins 2&5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q6920</TRANSISTOR>?
Check resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> line.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage level.

<TRANSISTOR>Q6920</TRANSISTOR> pin3 and 6 -1V and goes down
[/QUOTE]

Diode mode - 0L and 0L

threads.title: [SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Diode mode should give something. So either a broken trace to SMC or dead SMC.

Actually a broken trace is likely as there is also a pull-up resistor on this line, so if it is not shorted to GND the line should be pulled up to 3V42.

threads.title: [SOLVED]No magsafe <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
